card_creation_date.label: Creation Date
card_creation_date.description: Date of creation of the card. Ideally, this should match or closely follow the model's final release date. Creating the model card promptly after the model is finalized is good practice, as it helps ensure accurate and complete documentation. While it is possible to create model cards for already released models, this should be avoided or done carefully, as important information may be difficult to retrieve or lost over time. If different versions, this field should indicate the date of creation of the current version (see next field).

version_changes.label: Version Changes
version_changes.description: Describe the main changes or reason for upgrading the card with respect to the previous version. If this is the first version, indicate 'NA' (Not applicable).
version_changes.example: “New limitations of the model are found”, ”new evaluation on a different dataset is added”, etc.

doi.label: DOI
doi.description: Unique Digital Object Identifier for the current version on the card. If your card has been uploaded to a repository that provides DOI (e.g. Zenodo, HuggingFace), we encourage you to indicate the corresponding DOI.

creation_date.label: Creation Date
creation_date.description: Date when the model was created (i.e. when the model was trained and/or selected in its current version)

version_number.type: String, Free text format. Suggested format: MM.mm.bbbb where MM is the major release number, mm is the minor release number, and bbbb is the build number.
version_number.label: Version Number
version_number.format_description: Format: MM.mm.bbbb (two digits, dot, two digits, dot, four digits)

version_changes.label: Version Changes
version_changes.description: Description of the main changes with respect to the previous version. If this is the first version, please write 'NA' (Not applicable).
version_changes.example: “The loss function in version 1.0 was changed”, “A new pre-processing step was added”, etc.

doi.label: DOI
doi.description: Unique Digital Object Identifier for the current version of the model. If your model has been uploaded to a repository that provides DOI (e.g. Zenodo, HuggingFace), we encourage you to indicate the corresonding DOI.

model_scope_summary.label: Summary
model_scope_summary.description: One sentence summary of what the model does, including relevant information for the model input and output. Detailed specifications for input/output should go in the 'Technical Specifications' section.
model_scope_summary.example: Auto-segmentation model for HN OARs on CT

clearance_type.label: Type
clearance_type.description: Disclose if the model has been approved for medical use or not, and the model's regulatory clearance, if any.
clearance_type.example: Approved for medical use (in-house) by hospital team, FDA approved, CE approved, IMDD available, Not-approved for medical use - only research use.

clearance_approved_by_name.label: Name(s)
clearance_approved_by_name.description: Name of the person(s) who approved the model or contact person on behalf of the team. If several, separate them by commas.

clearance_approved_by_institution.label: Institution(s)
clearance_approved_by_institution.description: Institution(s) involved in the approval of the model. If several, separate them by commas.

clearance_approved_by_contact_email.label: Contact Email(s)
clearance_approved_by_contact_email.description: Contact email(s) for the team or persons. If several, separate them by commas.
clearance_approved_by_contact_email.format_description: Must be one or more valid email addresses separated by commas, e.g. user@example.com or user1@example.com, user2@example.org

clearance_additional_information.label: Additional Information
clearance_additional_information.description: Add any other information regarding the clearance / approval process you consider relevant (e.g. the qualification of the persons / team)

intended_users.label: Intended Users
intended_users.example: Radiation oncologists, medical physicists, and dosimetrists

observed_limitations.label: Observed Limitations
observed_limitations.description: Existing biases or limitations of the model, and particular cases for which the model has been tested and shown poor performance. Examples include imbalanced or missing training data, overfitting, generalizability and suitability for certain use cases, or de-identification methods used for the dataset that might influence the model performance (e.g. defacing of H&N scans)
observed_limitations.example: implants, contrast CT, post-operative patients, BMI > X, model not suitable for synthesising the nose since de-identification included defacing

potential_limitations.label: Potential Limitations
potential_limitations.description: Potential biases or limitations of the model. Specific cases, relevant to the model application (i.e. likely to arrive), for which the model may show poor performance.
potential_limitations.example: implants, contrast CT, post-operative patients, BMI > X

type_of_learning_architecture.label: Type of Learning Architecture
type_of_learning_architecture.description: Type of architecture for the learning model, if several models are used (e.g. cascade, cycle, tree,...), indicate all different types.

developed_by_name.label: Name
developed_by_name.description: Name of the person(s) who developed the model or contact person on behalf of the development team. If several, separate them by commas.

developed_by_institution.label: Institution
developed_by_institution.description: Institution(s) involved in the model development. Indicate single or multi-institutions involved in the model creation (indicating the role of each institute or the type of collaboration)

developed_by_email.label: Contact Email(s)
developed_by_email.description: Contact email for the development team or persons. If several, separate them by commas.
developed_by_email.format_description: Must be one or more valid email addresses separated by commas, e.g. user@example.com or user1@example.com, user2@example.org

conflict_of_interest.label: Conflict of Interest
conflict_of_interest.description: Disclose potential conflicts of interest, including, whenever applicable and possible, funding bodies involved in the development of the model. Otherwise, indicate “NA” (Not Applicable)

software_license.label: Software Licence
software_license.description: Software licence or copyright governing the use or redistribution of the model, source code and associated software to run it. Types include free and open (e.g. permissive, copyleft) and non-free (i.e. proprietary licence)

code_source.label: Code Source
code_source.description: Link(s) to repository (e.g. github/gitlab) or website where the code source of the learning architecture and inference pipeline is located. If the code source is not made available, indicate “NA” (Not applicable), or eventually, you might use this field to indicate the location / path in your internal computers.

model_source.label: Model source
model_source.description: Link to the trained learning model (i.e. weights) to run inference (e.g. HuggingFace, website, …). If the trained model is not made available, indicate “NA” (Not applicable), or eventually, you might use this field to indicate the path / location in your internal computers.

url_info.label: URL info
url_info.description: Link to a website with more information, or pdf

model_pipeline_summary.label: Summary
model_pipeline_summary.description: Short summary of the full model pipeline or workflow (in inference mode), including all sets of operations chained one after the other. Please remain high level here and leave technical details for the specific fields dedicated to pre-processing, post-processing, and learning architecture.
model_pipeline_summary.example: 'CT and MR images are rigidly registered and pre-processed, sent to a 3D nnUnet, which outputs nifti files that are later converted into DICOM RTSTRUCT compatible to our TPS'

model_pipeline_figure.label: Figure
model_pipeline_figure.description: Figure illustrating the model pipeline. If too big or not readable, please indicate the figure number and attach it to the appendix

model_inputs.label: Model inputs
options: MR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)
4DMR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)
model_inputs.description: Information about the inputs of the model pipeline, before pre-processing. This may include the format, content, and eventually other relevant (but short) information, like size. Further details should go in the pre-processing field.

model_outputs.label: Model outputs
options: MR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)
4DMR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)
model_outputs.description: Information about the outputs of the model pipeline, after post-processing. This may include the format, content, and eventually other relevant (but short) information, like size. Further details should go in the post-processing field.

pre_processing.label: Pre-processing
pre_processing.description: Details of the pre-processing operations performed to the model inputs. Please note that this refers to inference mode and excludes all data augmentation operations likely performed during training, which can be indicated in a separate field in the section “3. Training data, methodology, and information”
pre_processing.example: resample, patch based model, registration, cropping the body, artefact removal, table removing, contrast product removing, bias field correction, histogram clip...

post_processing.label: Post-processing
post_processing.description: Details of the post-processing operations to achieve the model outputs (typically performed to the learning architecture outputs)
post_processing.example: normalisation to D95 = 70Gy, resample, application of morphological operations (hole-filling)

total_number_trainable_parameters.label: Total number of trainable parameters
total_number_trainable_parameters.description: Total number of trainable parameters of the learning architecture
total_number_trainable_parameters.format_description: Must be a positive integer with up to 100000 digits, or a power of ten (e.g. 10^6, 10 ^ 6, or 10⁶).

number_of_inputs.label: Number of inputs
number_of_inputs.description: Number of inputs in the learning architecture. This may refer to channels (e.g., in CNNs), tokens (e.g., in transformers), feature vectors (e.g., in tabular models), etc
number_of_inputs.format_description: Must be a positive integer with up to 100000 digits, or a power of ten (e.g. 10^6, 10 ^ 6, or 10⁶).

input_content.label: Input Content
input_content.description: Expected content of each input, separated by commas.
options: MR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)
4DMR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)

additional_information_input_content.type: List of strings, same size as Input types
additional_information_input_content.label: Additional Information regarding input content
additional_information_input_content.description: This item enables further specification of input data, such as a specific MRI sequence not included in the list above, PET radiopharmaceutical, etc, but also more general items for multi-modal models, like prompting instructions, text length, etc. Additionally, you can specify if the expected inputs are also generated by another AI model (e.g. synthetic CT for contouring model). Please add the information in the same order as the input content. If no specification is needed for certain inputs, leave it empty. Specific acquisition parameters should be detailed in the sections Dataset (under training, validation, and evaluation).
additional_information_input_content.format_description: Comma-separated list of text items (e.g. T1 VIBE-Dixon). No quotes, special characters, or brackets.

input_format.type: List of strings, Free text format
input_format.label: Input Format
input_format.description: Matrix format of each input, separated by commas. Note that this is the format received by the main learning architecture of the model, after pre-processing steps
input_format.format_description: Must be a comma-separated list of words, either with brackets (e.g. [string, float, float]) or without (e.g. string, float, float). Letters, numbers, spaces, and hyphens are allowed.

input_size.label: Input Size
input_size.description: Size of each input, separated by commas. If only one entry while the number of inputs> 1, all inputs have the same size. If the size of the learning model inputs is not known or may vary according to the input data (e.g. it is extracted after an AutoML pre-process like in nnUnet), indicate “NA” (not applicable)
input_size.format_description: Must be 'NA' or 'N/A' (any case), a list of numbers (e.g. [128, 64, 64]), several lists separated by commas (e.g. [12], [89, 50]), or a list of lists (e.g. [[128], [64, 64]]).

number_of_outputs.label: Number of outputs
number_of_outputs.description: Number of outputs in the learning architecture. This may refer to channels (e.g., in CNNs), tokens (e.g., in transformers), feature vectors (e.g., in tabular models), etc
number_of_outputs.format_description: Must be a positive integer with up to 100000 digits, or a power of ten (e.g. 10^6, 10 ^ 6, or 10⁶).

output_content.label: Output Content
output_content.description: Modalities/types of each output, separated by commas
options: MR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)
4DMR SEQ (Use 'Additional Information regarding input content' to specify the sequence details)

additional_information_output_content.type: List of strings, same size as Output types
additional_information_output_content.label: Additional Information regarding input content
additional_information_output_content.description: This item enables further specification of output data, such as a specific MRI sequence not included in the list above, PET radiopharmaceutical, etc, but also more general items for multi-modal models, like prompting instructions, text length, etc. Additionally, you can specify if the expected outputs are also generated by another AI model (e.g. synthetic CT for contouring model). Please add the information in the same order as the output content. If no specification is needed for certain outputs, leave it empty. Specific acquisition parameters should be detailed in the sections Dataset (under training, validation, and evaluation).
additional_information_output_content.format_description: Comma-separated list of text items (e.g. T1 VIBE-Dixon). No quotes, special characters, or brackets.

output_format.type: List of strings, Free text format
output_format.label: Output Format
output_format.description: Matrix format of each output, separated by commas.
output_format.format_description: Must be a comma-separated list of words, either with brackets (e.g. [float, float, bool]) or without (e.g. float, float, bool). Letters, numbers, spaces, and hyphens are allowed.

output_size.label: Output Size
output_size.description: Size of each output, separated by commas. If only one entry while the number of outputs > 1, all outputs have the same size.
output_size.format_description: Must be 'NA' or 'N/A' (any case), a list of numbers (e.g. [128, 64, 64]), several lists separated by commas (e.g. [12], [89, 50]), or a list of lists (e.g. [[128], [64, 64]]).

loss_function.label: Loss Function
loss_function.description: Loss function used for training the learning architecture.

batch_size.label: Batch Size
batch_size.description: Size of the batch used to train the learning architecture.
batch_size.format_description: Must be a positive integer with up to 100000 digits, or a power of ten (e.g. 10^6, 10 ^ 6, or 10⁶).

regularisation.label: Regularisation
regularisation.description: Regularisation technique(s) applied during the training of the learning architecture.

architecture_figure.label: Architecture Figure
architecture_figure.description: Plot summarising the learning architecture and the main operations

uncertainty_quantification_techniques.label: Uncertainty Quantification Techniques
uncertainty_quantification_techniques.description: Uncertainty quantification techniques applied, if none, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable).
uncertainty_quantification_techniques.example: Monte Carlo dropout at inference (dropout = 0.2), variance of T predictions as uncertainty (T = 10)

explainability_techniques.label: Explainability Techniques
explainability_techniques.description: If any explainability technique has been used during the development of the model, please describe it. If none has been used, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable).
explainability_techniques.example: Class activation maps, LIME, attention modules, etc

additional_information_ts.label: Additional Information
additional_information_ts.description: Additional information regarding the learning architecture
additional_information_ts.example: number and type of layers, activation functions, type and size of pooling, kernel size, …

libraries_and_dependencies.label: Libraries and Dependencies
libraries_and_dependencies.description: Software libraries and dependencies for the model to run. We encourage you to add a requirements.txt as an appendix to this model card or hosted in an URL (e.g. github). In this case, fill in this field with the name or url of your requirements.txt file.

inference_time_for_recommended_hw.label: Inference time (s) for recommended hardware
inference_time_for_recommended_hw.description: Time to obtain model output (i.e.after the full model pipeline) when using recommended hardware, for a representative use-case
inference_time_for_recommended_hw.format_description: Must be a positive decimal number with a dot (e.g. 3.14, 8.0). Integers must include '.0'.

installation_getting_started.label: Installation / Getting started
installation_getting_started.description: URL to Installation procedure / code to run inference

environmental_impact.label: Environmental Impact
environmental_impact.description: Carbon emissions and other potential environmental impacts your model might have. Typically this is more relevant for the training process, but inference impact can also be added. Carbon emissions can be estimated using the Machine Learning Impact calculator ( https://mlco2.github.io/impact/#compute) presented in Lacoste et al. (2019). See also suggestions in HuggingFace model card for potential sub-fields.

model_name.label: Model Name
model_name.description: Name of the model from which it has been tuned from. If the model is not a tuned version of another model, indicate 'NA' (Not Applicable).

url_doi_to_model_card.label: URL/DOI to Model Card
url_doi_to_model_card.description: URL (or DOI if available) of the card associated to the model from which it has been tuned from. Indicate 'NA' (Not Applicable) if the model is not a tuned version of another model.

tuning_technique.label: Tuning Technique
tuning_technique.description: Technique used to train the model, indicate 'NA' (Not Applicable) if the model is not a tuned version of another model.

total_size.label: Total size
total_size.description: Number of total samples used for training -including validation -, including real and data augmented samples. If several folds have been trained with different training sizes, a list with as many entries as folds should be used. If the size is the same for all folds, a single entry can be used.
total_size.format_description: Must be one or more lists of integers in square brackets, e.g. [80] or [80], [80, 82, 78], separated by commas if multiple.

number_of_patients.label: Number of patients
number_of_patients.description: Number of different patients where the training samples are coming from. It can be equal or smaller (e.g. using repeated CT for the same patient, or having a 2D model) than the training size.
number_of_patients.format_description: Must be a positive integer with up to 100000 digits, or a power of ten (e.g. 10^6, 10 ^ 6, or 10⁶).

source.label: Source
source.description: Source(s) or owner(s) of the data. In the case of multi-institutional data collection, indicate all institutions and their role / amount of data provided.
source.example: Public dataset from Brats Challenge / Private dataset from ClinicX

acquisition_period.label: Acquisition period
acquisition_period.description: Period of time during which the data has been acquired.

inclusion_exclusion_criteria.label: Inclusion / exclusion criteria
inclusion_exclusion_criteria.description: Criteria used to include / exclude patients during the acquisition period.
inclusion_exclusion_criteria.example: Patients before 2015 were excluded because the delineation guidelines were different.

type_of_data_augmentation.label: Type of Data Augmentation
type_of_data_augmentation.description: Data augmentation operations performed (flipping, rotations, etc). Whenever relevant, please add both the type and the range/value of the operation (e.g. rotation ([-10º, +10º]). If none applied say “Not applicable”

strategy_for_data_augmentation.type: List of strings, Free text format
strategy_for_data_augmentation.label: Strategy for Data Augmentation
strategy_for_data_augmentation.description: Strategy for data augmentation. Whenever possible and relevant, report the number of augmented samples per real ones. If none applied say NA (Not Applicable).
strategy_for_data_augmentation.example: [random, on-the-fly during training, all], [prior-to-training, 5 augmented per real image]
strategy_for_data_augmentation.format_description: Must be 'NA' or 'N/A' (any case), or one or more lists of strings in square brackets (e.g. [random, on-the-fly during training, all], [prior-to-training, 5 augmented per real image]), separated by commas if multiple.

url_info.label: URL info
url_info.description: Link to more information, or pdf describing the dataset in detail

image_resolution.label: Image resolution
image_resolution.description: Pixel (if 2D images) or voxel (if 3D images) resolution (e.g. DICOM tags Pixel Spacing and Slice thickness), in millimetres. If images of several resolutions have been used, insert the median and range of them. Use a list of arrays, one for each image type defined in both 'model inputs' and 'model outputs' fields. Remember that this field refers to images before/after pre- and post- processing steps, respectively.

patient_positioning.label: Patient positioning
patient_positioning.description: Patient positioning during image acquisition or treatment delivery.

scanner_model.label: Scan(s) manufacturer and model
scanner_model.description: Manufacturer and model name of the image acquisition system. If the model has been trained with images acquired with different machines, include the information of each machine separated by commas. Indicate 'NA' whenever not relevant.

scan_acquisition_parameters.label: Scan(s) acquisition parameters
scan_acquisition_parameters.description: Acquisition parameters of the image acquisition system(s). If the model has been trained with images acquired with different machines, include the information of each machine separated by commas. Indicate 'NA' whenever not relevant. For MR: Magnetic Field (T), Repetition Time (ms), and Echo Time (ms) must be disclosed. For CT: Voltage (kV) must be disclosed.

scan_reconstruction_parameters.label: Scan(s) reconstruction parameters
scan_reconstruction_parameters.description: Algorithm and reconstruction parameters of the image acquisition system(s). If the model has been trained with images acquired with different machines, include the information of each machine separated by commas. Indicate 'NA' whenever not relevant. For CT: Algorithm and kernel must be disclosed.

fov.label: Field of View (FOV)
fov.description: Field-Of-View in mm of the acquired images. [left to right, posterior to anterior, inferior to superior]. If the model has been trained with images acquired with different FOV, include the median and range of them. Indicate “NA” (Not Applicable) whenever not relevant.

treatment_modality_train.label: Treatment modality
treatment_modality_train.description: List of radiotherapy treatment techniques for which the model has been trained for. If only one modality, then the list will have only one entry
options: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Passive scattering
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam multi-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam single-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - IMRT
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT
example: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT

beam_configuration_energy.label: Beam Configuration and Energy
beam_configuration_energy.description: Details of the beam configuration in the treatment plans used to train the model.

dose_engine.label: Dose Engine
dose_engine.description: Dose engine used to plan on the training dataset.

target_volumes_and_prescription.type: List of strings, Formatted as combinations of target volume type and prescriptions in cGy (i.e. Target_xxxx), separated by commas
target_volumes_and_prescription.label: Target volumes and prescription
target_volumes_and_prescription.description: List of target volumes and prescriptions in cGy.

number_of_fractions.type: List of floats or integers, Formatted as fraction numbers separated by commas, in the same order as the indicated target prescriptions
number_of_fractions.label: Number of fractions
number_of_fractions.description: Number of fractions for the given prescription list in the field 'Target prescription'
number_of_fractions.format_description: Must be a list of integers or floats in square brackets, separated by commas (e.g. [30, 30, 30] or [30.5, 29, 31.0]).

reference_standard.label: Reference Standard
reference_standard.description: Methods used to obtain reference standards, such as delineation guidelines, planning protocols, NTCP models used to guide planning, margins used for the PTV... If not relevant, then disclose “NA” (Not Applicable)
reference_standard.example: delineation guidelines Brouwer 2015 for HN organs

reference_standard_qa.label: Reference Standard QA
reference_standard_qa.description: Describe the quality assurance (QA) methods to ensure a high quality reference standard. For instance, how inter-observer variability in the annotations was dealt with when generating the training data. If no QA has been applied, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable)
reference_standard_qa.example: delineations checked and corrected by 2 radiation oncologists according to delineation guidelines

reference_standard_qa_additional_informa.label: Additional Information
reference_standard_qa_additional_informa.example: Use of paired data or not; if any QA of the machine has been done (es. magnetic field homogeneity and the spatial integrity); TG263 compliance to output format (e.g. tags for AI generated structures)

icd10_11.type: List of strings, Free text format
icd10_11.label: ICD10/11
icd10_11.description: ICD10/11 codes for the tumour location of the patients in the dataset.

tnm_staging.label: TNM staging
tnm_staging.description: Details of the TNM staging for the patients in the dataset (e.g. types and proportion).

age.label: Age
age.description: Median and range of the age of patients in the dataset. If not possible to retrieve (e.g. anonymisation), disclose 'NA'.

sex.label: Sex
sex.description: Proportion of M, F, or O (other) in the model. If not possible to retrieve (e.g. anonymisation), disclose 'NA'.

target_volume_cm3.type: List of strings, Free text format. One per type of target volume
target_volume_cm3.label: Target volume [cm3]
target_volume_cm3.description: Median and range of the target volumes of patients in the dataset. If several target volumes (GTV, CTVp, etc), use one entry per type.

bmi.label: BMI
bmi.description: Median and range of the BMI of patients in the dataset.

additional_patient_info.label: Additional information
additional_patient_info.description: Additional information regarding patient demographics and clinical characteristics.
additional_patient_info.example: post-operative, symmetry (e.g. only bilateral cases for HN), typical artefacts (e.g. metal) encountered, additional inclusion/exclusion criteria, etc.

validation_strategy.label: Validation strategy
validation_strategy.description: If a validation has been done, describe the strategy. Otherwise, disclose 'NA'.

validation_data_partition.type: List of strings, Free text format
validation_data_partition.label: Validation data partition
validation_data_partition.description: If a validation has been done, detail the data partition used for validation, in percentage (i.e. Nb validation / (Nb. validation + Nb. training)). If several folds have been used and the partition was different for each fold, use a list, otherwise, use a single value. If no validation has been performed, disclose “NA” (not applicable).Detail the data partition used for validation (e.g. percentages). If folds differ, use a list.
validation_data_partition.format_description: Must be 'NA' or 'N/A' (any case), a single percentage (e.g. 15%, 12.5%), or a bracketed list of percentages (e.g. [15%], [20%, 30%]).

weights_initialization.label: Weights Initialization
weights_initialization.description: Technique used to initialise the weights of the trainable parameters of the learning architecture

epochs.label: Epochs
epochs.description: Number of epochs the model has been trained for, and for which the provided weights correspond. If multiple folds are trained, use a list of Integers with each entry corresponding to one fold. If you have trained for longer but used early stopping to choose your model, please add the epochs at the moment of the early stopping and specify the 'model choice criteria' in the corresponding field
epochs.format_description: Must be a list of integers in square brackets, separated by commas (e.g. [1], [10, 20, 30]).

optimiser.label: Optimiser
optimiser.description: Optimiser used during the training of the learning architecture

train_and_validation_loss_curves.label: Train and Validation Loss Curves
train_and_validation_loss_curves.description: Figure of the training and validation losses

model_choice_criteria.label: Model Choice Criteria
model_choice_criteria.description: Process to choose your final model(s).
model_choice_criteria.example: last epoch, early stopping based on validation,..

inference_method.label: Inference Method
inference_method.description: Method used to obtain your final prediction from your learning architecture, excluding post-processing steps.
inference_method.example: single (best-performing) fold, Average of all folds, major voting, …

evaluation_date.label: Evaluation Date
evaluation_date.description: Date of evaluation of the model

evaluated_by_name.label: Name
evaluated_by_name.description: Name of the person(s) who evaluated the model or contact person on behalf of the team. If several, separate them by commas.

evaluated_by_institution.label: Institution
evaluated_by_institution.description: Institution(s) involved in the evaluation of the model. If several, separate them by commas.

evaluated_by_contact_email.label: Contact Email
evaluated_by_contact_email.description: Contact email(s) for the team or persons. If several, separate them by commas.
evaluated_by_contact_email.format_description: Must be one or more valid email addresses separated by commas, e.g. user@example.com or user1@example.com, user2@example.org

evaluation_frame.label: Evaluation Frame
evaluation_frame.description: Details of the evaluation process, frame, and conditions, e.g. retrospective or prospective, by radiation oncologists, under specific time constraints, etc.

sanity_check.label: Sanity Check
sanity_check.description: Description of the sanity check performed on the model. This is a test to ensure that the model is functioning correctly and producing expected outputs.
sanity_check.example: The model was tested on a set of known images and produced expected segmentation results.

total_size.label: Total size
total_size.description: Number of total samples used for evaluation-including validation -, including real and data augmented samples. If several folds have been evaluated with different evaluation sizes, a list with as many entries as folds should be used. If the size is the same for all folds, a single entry can be used.
total_size.format_description: Must be one or more lists of integers in square brackets, e.g. [80] or [80], [80, 82, 78], separated by commas if multiple.

number_of_patients.label: Number of patients
number_of_patients.description: Number of different patients used in the evaluation set. It can be equal or smaller (e.g. using repeated CT for the same patient, or having a 2D model) than the evaluation size.f
number_of_patients.format_description: Must be a positive integer with up to 100000 digits, or a power of ten (e.g. 10^6, 10 ^ 6, or 10⁶).

source.label: Source
source.description: Source(s) or owner(s) of the data. In the case of multi-institutional data collection, indicate all institutions and their role / amount of data provided.
source.example: Public dataset from Brats Challenge / Private dataset from ClinicX

acquisition_period.label: Acquisition period
acquisition_period.description: Period of time during which the data has been acquired.

inclusion_exclusion_criteria.label: Inclusion / exclusion criteria
inclusion_exclusion_criteria.description: Criteria used to include / exclude patients during the acquisition period.
inclusion_exclusion_criteria.example: Patients before 2015 were excluded because the delineation guidelines were different.

url_info.label: URL info
url_info.description: Link to more information, or pdf describing the dataset in detail

image_resolution.label: Image resolution
image_resolution.description: Pixel (if 2D images) or voxel (if 3D images) resolution (e.g. DICOM tags Pixel Spacing and Slice thickness), in millimetres. If images of several resolutions have been used, insert the median and range of them. Use a list of arrays, one for each image type defined in both 'model inputs' and 'model outputs' fields. Remember that this field refers to images before/after pre- and post- processing steps, respectively.

patient_positioning.label: Patient positioning
patient_positioning.description: Patient positioning during image acquisition or treatment delivery. Indicate 'NA' whenever not relevant nor applicable.

scanner_model.label: Scan(s) manufacturer and model
scanner_model.description: Manufacturer and model name of the image acquisition system. If the model has been evaluated with images acquired with different machines, include the information of each machine separated by commas. Indicate 'NA' whenever not relevant.

scan_acquisition_parameters.label: Scan(s) acquisition parameters
scan_acquisition_parameters.description: Acquisition parameters of the image acquisition system(s). If the model has been evaluated with images acquired with different machines, include the information of each machine separated by commas. Indicate 'NA' whenever not relevant. For MR: Magnetic Field (T), Repetition Time (ms), and Echo Time (ms) must be disclosed. For CT: Voltage (kV) must be disclosed.

scan_reconstruction_parameters.label: Scan(s) reconstruction parameters
scan_reconstruction_parameters.description: Algorithm and reconstruction parameters of the image acquisition system(s). If the model has been evaluated with images acquired with different machines, include the information of each machine separated by commas. Indicate 'NA' whenever not relevant. For CT: Algorithm and kernel must be disclosed.

fov.label: Field of View (FOV)
fov.description: Field-Of-View in mm of the acquired images. [left to right, posterior to anterior, inferior to superior]. If the model has been trained with images acquired with different FOV, include the median and range of them. Indicate “NA” (Not Applicable) whenever not relevant.

treatment_modality_eval.label: Treatment modality
treatment_modality_eval.description: List of radiotherapy treatment techniques for which the model has been evaluated on. If only one modality, then the list will have only one entry
options: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Passive scattering
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam multi-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam single-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - IMRT
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT
example: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT

beam_configuration_energy.label: Beam Configuration and Energy
beam_configuration_energy.description: Details of the beam configuration in the treatment plans used to evaluate the model.

dose_engine.label: Dose Engine
dose_engine.description: Dose engine used to plan on the evaluation dataset.

target_volumes_and_prescription.type: List of strings, Formatted as combinations of target volume type and prescriptions in cGy (i.e. Target_xxxx), separated by commas
target_volumes_and_prescription.label: Target volumes and prescription
target_volumes_and_prescription.description: List of target volumes and prescriptions in cGy.

number_of_fractions.type: List of floats or integers, Formatted as fraction numbers separated by commas, in the same order as the indicated target prescriptions
number_of_fractions.label: Number of fractions
number_of_fractions.description: Number of fractions for the given prescription list in the field 'Target prescription'
number_of_fractions.format_description: Must be a list of integers or floats in square brackets, separated by commas (e.g. [30, 30, 30] or [30.5, 29, 31.0]).

reference_standard.label: Reference Standard
reference_standard.description: Methods used to obtain reference standards, such as delineation guidelines, planning protocols, NTCP models used to guide planning, margins used for the PTV... If not relevant, then disclose “NA” (Not Applicable)
reference_standard.example: delineation guidelines Brouwer 2015 for HN organs

reference_standard_qa.label: Reference Standard QA
reference_standard_qa.description: Describe the quality assurance (QA) methods to ensure a high quality reference standard. For instance, how inter-observer variability in the annotations was dealt with when generating the evaluation data. If no QA has been applied, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable)
reference_standard_qa.example: delineations checked and corrected by 2 radiation oncologists according to delineation guidelines

reference_standard_qa_additional_informa.label: Additional Information
reference_standard_qa_additional_informa.example: Use of paired data or not; if any QA of the machine has been done (es. magnetic field homogeneity and the spatial integrity); TG263 compliance to output format (e.g. tags for AI generated structures)

icd10_11_ev.label: ICD10/11
icd10_11_ev.description: ICD10/11 codes for the tumour location of the patients in the dataset.

tnm_staging_ev.label: TNM staging
tnm_staging_ev.description: Details of the TNM staging for the patients in the dataset (e.g. types and proportion).

age_ev.label: Age
age_ev.description: Median and range of the age of patients in the dataset. If not possible to retrieve (e.g. anonymisation), disclose 'NA'.

sex_ev.label: Sex
sex_ev.description: Proportion of M, F, or O (other) in the model. If not possible to retrieve (e.g. anonymisation), disclose 'NA'.

target_volume_cm3_ev.type: List of strings, Free text format. One per type of target volume
target_volume_cm3_ev.label: Target volume [cm3]
target_volume_cm3_ev.description: Median and range of the target volumes of patients in the dataset. If several target volumes (GTV, CTVp, etc), use one entry per type.

bmi_ev.label: BMI
bmi_ev.description: Median and range of the BMI of patients in the dataset.

additional_patient_info_ev.label: Additional information
additional_patient_info_ev.description: Additional information regarding patient demographics and clinical characteristics.
additional_patient_info_ev.example: post-operative, symmetry (e.g. only bilateral cases for HN), typical artefacts (e.g. metal) encountered, additional inclusion/exclusion criteria, etc.

on_volume_ism.label: onVolume
on_volume_ism.description: Volume for which the metric was computed. Leave empty if not applicable.

registration_ism.label: Registration
registration_ism.description: Type of registration between real and generated synthetic images

sample_data_ism.label: Sample Data
sample_data_ism.description: If the metric values for each sample in the evaluation dataset are available in the model card appendix or somewhere else, please indicate the location of it (e.g. page, table index, figure index, url...)

mean_data_ism.label: Mean Data
mean_data_ism.description: Mean, range, and standard deviation for the entire evaluation dataset.
mean_data_ism.format_description: Must be a list of exactly four decimal numbers in square brackets (e.g. [1.0, 2.5, 3.14, 4.0]). Integers must include '.0'.

figure_ism.label: Figure
figure_ism.description: A figure including a representation of the metric values, such as bars, scatter plots, box plots, etc

type_dose_dm.label: Type
type_dose_dm.description: Type of metrics used to quantify dosimetric differences between treatment plans generated on real and synthetic images. GPR = gamma passing rate, DXX = dose to XX% of volume (e.g. D95), VXX = volume receiving XX% of the dose (e.g. V20).

metric_specifications_dm.label: Metric Specifications
metric_specifications_dm.description: Specifications on how the metric is defined. Indicate 'NA' when not relevant. For GPR: 2D/3D, local or global, DD/DTA threshold, dose threshold (>x%) and evaluation threshold must be disclosed.

on_volume_dm.label: onVolume
on_volume_dm.description: Volume for which the metric was computed. Leave empty if not applicable.

registration_dm.label: Registration
registration_dm.description: Type of registration between real and generated synthetic images

treatment_modality_dm.label: Treatment modality
treatment_modality_dm.description: Treatment technique used to plan on the evaluation dataset.
options: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Passive scattering
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam multi-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam single-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - IMRT
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT
example: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT

dose_engine_dm.label: Dose Engine
dose_engine_dm.description: Dose engine used to plan on the evaluation dataset.

dose_grid_resolution_dm.label: Dose Grid Resolution
dose_grid_resolution_dm.description: Dose grid used to plan on the evaluation dataset. Format: array of 1x3, millimetres.
dose_grid_resolution_dm.format_description: Must be an array of exactly three integers or floats in square brackets, e.g. [1, 2, 3] or [1.5, 2, 3.25].

tps_vendor_dm.label: TPS Vendor
tps_vendor_dm.description: TPS used to plan on the evaluation dataset.

sample_data_dm.type: list[float]. Array of floats, same size as the evaluation dataset
sample_data_dm.label: Sample Data
sample_data_dm.description: Metric values for each sample in the evaluation dataset. For metrics of type DXX, VXX, an array of two columns must be used, the first one for the metric value on the real image and the second for that on the predicted image.

mean_data_dm.label: Mean Data
mean_data_dm.description: Mean, range, and standard deviation for the entire evaluation dataset.
mean_data_dm.format_description: Must be a list of exactly four decimal numbers in square brackets (e.g. [1.0, 2.5, 3.14, 4.0]). Integers must include '.0'.

figure_dm.label: Figure
figure_dm.description: A figure including a representation of the metric values, such as bars, scatter plots, box plots, etc

type_gm_seg.label: Type
type_gm_seg.description: Type of similarity metrics between the real and generated contours.

metric_specifications_gm_seg.label: Metric Specifications
metric_specifications_gm_seg.description: Specifications on how the metric is defined. Indicate 'NA' when not relevant. For GPR: 2D/3Dmust be disclosed.

on_volume_gm_seg.label: onVolume
on_volume_gm_seg.description: Volume for which the metric was computed. Leave empty if not applicable.

sample_data_gm_seg.type: list[float]. Array of floats, same size as the evaluation dataset
sample_data_gm_seg.label: Sample Data
sample_data_gm_seg.description: Metric values for each sample in the evaluation dataset. For metrics of type DXX, VXX, an array of two columns must be used, the first one for the metric value on the real image and the second for that on the predicted image.

mean_data_gm_seg.label: Mean Data
mean_data_gm_seg.description: Mean, range, and standard deviation for the entire evaluation dataset.
mean_data_gm_seg.format_description: Must be a list of exactly four decimal numbers in square brackets (e.g. [1.0, 2.5, 3.14, 4.0]). Integers must include '.0'.

figure_gm_seg.label: Figure
figure_gm_seg.description: A figure including a representation of the metric values, such as bars, scatter plots, box plots, etc

type_dose_dm_seg.label: Type
type_dose_dm_seg.description: Type of metrics used to quantify dosimetric differences between treatment plans generated on real and synthetic images. GPR = gamma passing rate, DXX = dose to XX% of volume (e.g. D95), VXX = volume receiving XX% of the dose (e.g. V20).

metric_specifications_dm_seg.label: Metric Specifications
metric_specifications_dm_seg.description: Specifications on how the metric is defined. Indicate 'NA' when not relevant. For GPR: 2D/3D, local or global, DD/DTA threshold, dose threshold (>x%) and evaluation threshold must be disclosed.

on_volume_dm_seg.label: onVolume
on_volume_dm_seg.description: Volume for which the metric was computed. Leave empty if not applicable.

treatment_modality_dm_seg.label: Treatment modality
treatment_modality_dm_seg.description: Treatment technique used to plan on the evaluation dataset.
options: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Passive scattering
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam multi-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Protons - Scanning beam single-field optimization
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - IMRT
External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT
example: External beam radiation therapy (EBRT) - Photons (LINAC) - VMAT

dose_engine_dm_seg.label: Dose Engine
dose_engine_dm_seg.description: Dose engine used to plan on the evaluation dataset.

dose_grid_resolution_dm_seg.label: Dose Grid Resolution
dose_grid_resolution_dm_seg.description: Dose grid used to plan on the evaluation dataset. Format: array of 1x3, millimetres.
dose_grid_resolution_dm_seg.format_description: Must be an array of exactly three integers or floats, e.g. [1, 2, 3] or [1.5, 2, 3.25].

tps_vendor_dm_seg.label: TPS Vendor
tps_vendor_dm_seg.description: TPS used to plan on the evaluation dataset.

sample_data_dm_seg.type: list[float]. Array of floats, same size as the evaluation dataset
sample_data_dm_seg.label: Sample Data
sample_data_dm_seg.description: Metric values for each sample in the evaluation dataset. For metrics of type DXX, VXX, an array of two columns must be used, the first one for the metric value on the real image and the second for that on the predicted image.

mean_data_dm_seg.label: Mean Data
mean_data_dm_seg.description: Mean, range, and standard deviation for the entire evaluation dataset.
mean_data_dm_seg.format_description: Must be a list of exactly four decimal numbers in square brackets (e.g. [1.0, 2.5, 3.14, 4.0]). Integers must include '.0'.

figure_dm_seg.label: Figure
figure_dm_seg.description: A figure including a representation of the metric values, such as bars, scatter plots, box plots, etc

iov_method_seg.label: Method
iov_method_seg.description: Method used to evaluate the potential improvement in IOV for the (corrected) predicted contours versus the clinical state-of-the-art (e.g. contouring from scratch (manually), atlas-based, etc). Specify the method (e.g. how many clinicians participated, how long, etc) and the metric and units to quantify it (e.g. millimeters)

type_metrics_other.label: Type
type_metrics_other.description: Name of the metric used to evaluate your model (e.g. difference between the predictions and ground truth labels)

additional_info_other.label: Additional Information
additional_info_other.description: Additional information about the metric used to evaluate your model (e.g. conditions in which it is calculated, formula used, ...)

sample_data_other.type: list[float]. Array of floats, same size as the evaluation dataset
sample_data_other.label: Sample Data
sample_data_other.description: Metric values for each sample in the evaluation dataset.

mean_data_other.label: Mean Data
mean_data_other.description: Mean, range, and standard deviation for the entire evaluation dataset.
mean_data_other.format_description: Must be a list of exactly four decimal numbers in square brackets (e.g. [1.0, 2.5, 3.14, 4.0]). Integers must include '.0'.

figure_other.label: Figure
figure_other.description: A figure including a representation of the metric values, such as bars, scatter plots, box plots, etc

type_dose_dm_dp.label: Type
type_dose_dm_dp.description: Type of metrics used to quantify dosimetric differences between real and predicted doses.

metric_specifications_dm_dp.label: Metric Specifications
metric_specifications_dm_dp.description: Specifications on how the metric is defined. Indicate 'NA' when not relevant. For GPR: 2D/3D, local or global, DD/DTA threshold, dose threshold (>x%) and evaluation threshold must be disclosed.

on_volume_dm_dp.label: onVolume
on_volume_dm_dp.description: Volume for which the metric was computed. Leave empty if not applicable.

dose_grid_resolution_dm_dp.label: Dose Grid Resolution
dose_grid_resolution_dm_dp.description: Dose grid used to plan on the evaluation dataset. Format: array of 1x3, millimetres.
dose_grid_resolution_dm_dp.format_description: Must be an array of exactly three integers or floats, e.g. [1, 2, 3] or [1.5, 2, 3.25].

sample_data_dm_dp.type: list[float]. Array of floats, same size as the evaluation dataset
sample_data_dm_dp.label: Sample Data
sample_data_dm_dp.description: Metric values for each sample in the evaluation dataset. For metrics of type DXX, VXX, an array of two columns must be used, the first one for the metric value on the real image and the second for that on the predicted image.

mean_data_dm_dp.label: Mean Data
mean_data_dm_dp.description: Mean, range, and standard deviation for the entire evaluation dataset.
mean_data_dm_dp.format_description: Must be a list of exactly four decimal numbers in square brackets (e.g. [1.0, 2.5, 3.14, 4.0]). Integers must include '.0'.

figure_dm_dp.label: Figure
figure_dm_dp.description: A figure including a representation of the metric values, such as bars, scatter plots, box plots, etc

uncertainty_metrics_method.label: Method
uncertainty_metrics_method.description: If uncertainty quantification techniques have been applied, please describe the metrics and method used to evaluate them, and eventually how the model was calibrated. If no uncertainty quantification techniques were applied please add “NA” (not applicable).
uncertainty_metrics_method.example: Average Pearson correlation between DSC and uncertainty.

evaluators_information.label: Evaluators information
evaluators_information.description: Information about the evaluators, such as number of evaluators, years of experience, role (RTT, radOnc, physicist). If not evaluated or not relevant, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable).

likert_scoring_method.label: Method
likert_scoring_method.description: Method or scale used for the Likert scoring, measuring either positive or negative human evaluation for the model predictions. If not evaluated or not relevant, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable).
likert_scoring_method.example: “Five-level Likert item includes: 1) Strongly disagree, 2) Disagree, 3) Neither agree nor disagree, 4) Agree, and 5) Strongly agree”

turing_test_method.label: Method
turing_test_method.description: Metric and method used to test indistinguishability in performance capacity of the model with respect to humans. If not evaluated or not relevant, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable).

time_saving_method.label: Method
time_saving_method.description: Metric and method used to evaluate the time saving when using the predictions of the models.  If not evaluated or not relevant, disclose “NA” (Not Applicable).

other_method.label: Method
other_method.description: Metric and method used to evaluate Other end-point

explainability.label: Explainability
explainability.description: If any explainability technique has been used, please describe the results during the evaluation process. If none has been used, disclose “NA” (not applicable).
explainability.example: Class activation maps showed that the model was mainly focussing in relevant areas (i.e the centre of the image) to make the prediction.

responsible_use_and_ethical_consideratio.label: Responsible Use and Ethical Considerations
responsible_use_and_ethical_consideratio.description: This covers any ethical or responsible AI considerations related to the model, such as privacy concerns, fairness and transparency, or potential societal impacts of the model's use. Please do not be redundant with the field “Observed limitations” and “Potential biases” in model basic information. It may also include recommendations for further testing.

risk_analysis.label: Risk Analysis
risk_analysis.description: URL to Failure Mode and Effects Analysis or similar risk analysis tool.

post_market_surveillance_live_monitoring.label: Post-Market Surveillance / Live Monitoring
post_market_surveillance_live_monitoring.description: Recommendations for monitoring the model during clinical use and deployment.
